intro: Vesicaria shortii, commonly known as the Short's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Vesicaria shortii is considered a rare and endangered species.
